DataElement.preferredName: FACT-B+4 Questionnaire Version 4 Q6 How True Past Seven Days Side of Breast Operation Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of the side of their breast operation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-B+4 Questionnaire Side of Breast Operation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subscale complement to the FACT-G developed specifically for use with the FACT-B questionnaire for evaluating the quality of life of breast cancer patients with lymphedema._A question about on which side an individual had breast surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subscale complement to the FACT-G developed specifically for use with the FACT-B questionnaire for evaluating the quality of life of breast cancer patients with lymphedema.

ValueDomain.preferredName: FACT B+4 Breast Laterality Anatomic Site
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the side of the body used in the FACT-B+4 questionnaire.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the east when facing north.

Concepts.definition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the east when facing north.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the west when facing north.

Concepts.definition: The hemispheric projection, including the mammary gland, located on the anterior portion of the chest, lateral to the midline, on the side of the body to the west when facing north.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Link to Scoring and Interpretation Materials
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.
